newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel, Niger renew ties after 23 years.
newsitem.headline: Israel, Niger renew ties after 23 years.

text.p: Israel and Niger on Thursday revived diplomatic relations severed 23 years ago, Israel's Foreign Ministry said.
Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy signed an agreement to reopen relations with his counterpart from Niger, Andre Salifou, at Levy's Jerusalem office, the ministry said.
Niger, 85 percent of whose people are Moslem, broke off ties with Israel along with many other African countries after the 1973 Middle East war.
The ministry said Israel now maintained ties with 162 countries, 41 of them in Africa. Most Arab and Moslem states shun ties with the Jewish state.
